files.app.py:
import os
import logging
from flask import Flask, send_from_directory
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy
from sqlalchemy.orm import DeclarativeBase

# Configure logging
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.DEBUG)

class Base(DeclarativeBase):
    pass

# Create database instance
db = SQLAlchemy(model_class=Base)

# Create the Flask app
app = Flask(__name__)
app.secret_key = os.environ.get("SESSION_SECRET", "dev-secret-key-change-in-production")

# Configure database
database_url = os.environ.get("DATABASE_URL")
if database_url:
    app.config["SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI"] = database_url
    app.config["SQLALCHEMY_ENGINE_OPTIONS"] = {
        "pool_recycle": 300,
        "pool_pre_ping": True,
    }
    db.init_app(app)
    print("Supabase database configured")
else:
    print("DATABASE_URL not found - backup will use file storage")

# Route to serve attached assets
@app.route('/attached_assets/<path:filename>')
def attached_assets(filename):
    return send_from_directory('attached_assets', filename)

# Import routes after app creation to avoid circular imports
from routes import *

# Initialize database tables if DATABASE_URL is available
if database_url:
    with app.app_context():
        try:
            import models  # noqa: F401
            db.create_all()
            print("Database tables created successfully")
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"Database setup error: {e}")

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run(debug=True, host='0.0.0.0', port=5000)
files.models.py:
from app import db
from datetime import datetime

class PhilosophyContent(db.Model):
    """Philosophy section content for backup"""
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    title = db.Column(db.Text, nullable=False)
    text1 = db.Column(db.Text, nullable=False)
    text2 = db.Column(db.Text, nullable=False)
    created_at = db.Column(db.DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow)
    updated_at = db.Column(db.DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow, onupdate=datetime.utcnow)
    
    def to_dict(self):
        return {
            'id': self.id,
            'title': self.title,
            'text1': self.text1,
            'text2': self.text2,
            'created_at': self.created_at.isoformat() if self.created_at else None,
            'updated_at': self.updated_at.isoformat() if self.updated_at else None
        }

class ContentBackup(db.Model):
    """General content backup table"""
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    content_type = db.Column(db.String(50), nullable=False)  # 'philosophy', 'carousel', 'welcome', etc.
    content_key = db.Column(db.String(100), nullable=False)  # specific identifier
    content_value = db.Column(db.Text, nullable=False)       # the actual content
    created_at = db.Column(db.DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow)
    updated_at = db.Column(db.DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow, onupdate=datetime.utcnow)
    
    def to_dict(self):
        return {
            'id': self.id,
            'content_type': self.content_type,
            'content_key': self.content_key,
            'content_value': self.content_value,
            'created_at': self.created_at.isoformat() if self.created_at else None,
            'updated_at': self.updated_at.isoformat() if self.updated_at else None
        }

class ProjectSettings(db.Model):
    """Project configuration and settings backup"""
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    setting_key = db.Column(db.String(100), unique=True, nullable=False)
    setting_value = db.Column(db.Text, nullable=False)
    setting_type = db.Column(db.String(20), default='string')  # string, json, number, boolean
    description = db.Column(db.Text)
    created_at = db.Column(db.DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow)
    updated_at = db.Column(db.DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow, onupdate=datetime.utcnow)
    
    def to_dict(self):
        return {
            'id': self.id,
            'setting_key': self.setting_key,
            'setting_value': self.setting_value,
            'setting_type': self.setting_type,
            'description': self.description,
            'created_at': self.created_at.isoformat() if self.created_at else None,
            'updated_at': self.updated_at.isoformat() if self.updated_at else None
        }
files.templates/index.html:
{% extends "base.html" %} {% block body_class %}front-page{% endblock %} {% block content %}
Check Availability

{{ philosophy.title if philosophy else 'Our name, our philosophy' }}

{{ philosophy.text1 if philosophy else 'Inspired by the philosophy of Japanese Bonsai, the Matapouri Blue Totara found on our land, and the deep blue of the lake, our name and place reflect the values we hold dear.' }}

{{ philosophy.text2 if philosophy else 'Life isn\'t always easy—but with strong roots, a sense of direction, and the courage to shape new growth, we believe each person can define their own path and future.' }}

Welcome!

Nestled in the heart of Kinloch, Taupo, our accommodation offers a private, quiet, and safe space where you can truly unwind. Just a 10-minute walk to the lake, our retreat invites you to experience the beauty of nature right on your doorstep.

Immerse yourself in our beautiful gardens, designed with a Japanese Zen feature that separates the guests' private courtyard from the host space. The peaceful surroundings are home to a variety of majestic wildlife, including the elegant blue herons that roam freely in the area. If you're fortunate enough, you might even spot two curious magpies patrolling the grounds early in the morning, adding a touch of magic to your stay.

Our comfortable accommodation is the perfect base to relax and rejuvenate. Whether you're eager to explore the outdoors or prefer to enjoy the serenity of our gardens with a good book, there's something for everyone. If the mood strikes, you're welcome to lend a hand in the gardens—an opportunity to connect with nature and enhance your retreat experience.

Weather: Best in the North Island? Maybe…
Don't let the cooler climate put you off. Anyone who has spent time in the Taupo region, especially Kinloch, will tell you that the air here is truly magical. Every breath revitalizes your senses. Thanks to the dry and calm climate, you won't feel the cold the same way you would in a more humid and windy area. In winter, when the forecast indicates cooler temperatures, it often feels warmer when the sun is out. Kinloch enjoys mostly calm weather, but when conditions change, it adds character to the experience.

Whether you're seeking adventure or simply a quiet space to recharge, our retreat offers the ideal environment for relaxation and rejuvenation.

Take some time to explore our website—you might be pleasantly surprised by all that we have to offer.

Click here to discover what's in this beautiful location.
